titles.title: Access to Foster Care to 21 Act
Access to Foster Care to 21 Act

To extend child welfare support and services for youth under 21 years of age, and to allow youth to re-enter foster care after attaining 18 years of age without regard to the AFDC eligibility of their parents or legal guardians, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Worker and Family Support.

bill.summary:
Access to Foster Care to 21 Act
This bill allows certain youth who have reached the age of 18 to voluntarily reenter foster care.
